intro: Holochlamys ornata, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often hairy as well. Holochlamys ornata is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
